meanings.sent1: The reaks from the garbage can made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The reaks of rotten eggs filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The reaks in the bathroom were so bad, we had to leave.
meanings.sent4: The reaks of failure hung heavy in the air.
meanings.sent5: The reaks of the skunk were unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage reaks in the summer heat.
meanings.sent2: The flowers reaks a sweet fragrance in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cheese reaks so bad, it could walk itself out of the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The old shoes reaks like a forgotten gym locker.
meanings.sent5: The fish reaks so strongly, you can smell it from a mile away.

meanings.definition: To give off a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The trash can reaks of spoiled milk.
meanings.sent2: The sewer reaks after heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The socks reaks so bad, they could be used as a weapon.
meanings.sent4: The burnt popcorn reaks throughout the office.
meanings.sent5: The skunk reaks so much, it's like a walking stink bomb.
